availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Lockport Will County Illinois
February 27th 1863
Mr. John Fleming
Sir.

I am in receipt of yours of Feby 23rd and in answer will State that the Matter of your Petition has been fordwarded to the Governor about Ten days ago. we thought it better to send it to the Govr direct.
I have no doubt but it will be Seccessful you can urge your friends to remind the Govr about it. there is not the least doubt in my mind but he will act upon it.
Your family are well. So also your old friends.
I would like to inform you what is going on here were it not for all the Secesh about Me at this moment.
Barney and all the Boys are well
letter to John Fleming about this Pettn
